com.github.ilyes4j.gwt.mdl.components

Class MdlGwtUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.ilyes4j.gwt.mdl.components.MdlGwtUtils

  • public final class MdlGwtUtils
extends Object
    Contains general purpose and recurring code snippet used through out the project. This class centralizes all these procedures to avoid code duplication and redundancy.
    Author:
    Mohamed Ilyes DIMASSI

    • Method Detail

      • insureId

        public static void insureId(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element element)
        Makes sure the element parameter have an id. If the element contains an id, then nothing happens, otherwise, the element is provided with a generated unique id.
        Parameters:
        element - the element for which an id should be insured

      • setFor

        public static void setFor(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element element,
          String value)
        Helper method that sets the value to the "for" attribute in a DOM element. This attribute helps wiring parts together inside an mdl component and also binds mdl components together. The "for" indicates that the the embedding element is referencing another element in the component. The value of the "for" attribute is the id of the referenced element.
        Parameters:
        element - the target element to be processed
        value - the value tobe set to the "for" attribute

      • assertIndex

        public static void assertIndex(int size,
               int index)
        Make sure the index provided as input is inside the range of possible elements of a list.
        Parameters:
        size - the size of the list
        index - the index to be checked

      • addStyle

        public static void addStyle(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject object,
            Object style)
        When UIObject.addStyleName(String) is invoked with an empty style name, it raises an exception. In mdl, the absence of a selector is interpreted as the default option for the behavior. For this reason, we need an alternative to UIObject.addStyleName(String) that does not raise an exception when it encounter an empty css selector.
        Parameters:
        object - the widget to which the css selector will be applied
        style - any Object with a Object.toString() method returning the css selector to be applied.

      • removeStyle

        public static void removeStyle(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject object,
               Object style)
        Same behavior as addStyle(UIObject, Object) but for UIObject.removeStyleName(String).
        Parameters:
        object - the widget to which the css selector will be applied
        style - any Object with a Object.toString() method returning the css selector to be applied.
        See Also:
        addStyle(UIObject, Object)

      • addClass

        public static void addClass(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element element,
            Object style)
        Parameters:
        element - the Element to which the css class will be applied
        style - any Object with a Object.toString() method returning the css class to be applied.
        See Also:
        assertStyle(Object, Object)

      • removeClass

        public static void removeClass(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element element,
               Object style)
        Same behavior as removeStyle(UIObject, Object) applied to Element.
        Parameters:
        element - the Element to which the css selector will be applied
        style - any Object with a Object.toString() method returning the css selector to be applied.
